title: 10: Journey of The Stranger
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local 
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625) 
 **Current whereabouts**: Node 787 
 **Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

I’m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have been…interesting, but I’ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still don’t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. It’s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I can’t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792). 

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmission for your perusal at a later date. Be well.


---

### From the journal of Erkeil The Stranger. Day 15

![Erkeil The Stranger](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7B9PrMnpPXEY47t3dsDSP.png?height=400&width=400)

Though it seems like an age, it’s been little more than a fortnight since I woke in this land. Everything is strange and unfamiliar to me, and I, as well, am strange, even to myself.

What I know of my past is given to me in dreams, fragments of memory, though even so, I’m cannot be sure which are my own, or if they belong to another. I do not know who I am. I don’t feel completely at home is this body, nor do I feel completely alone in my thoughts. It’s as if there is another presence, perhaps more than one, sharing my thoughts. I am one, but not alone.

There is Hadrian, my new…I will call him a companion, though, in fact he is more akin to a thrall, enslaved in some sense and bound to me by the weirding power held within the strange iron crown that rides my brow. We met on the road, after the fog and I think he meant me ill, as so many I have encountered have. I am still…unclear what forced the change in him, but know it is related to the crown that marks me as stranger.

Hadrian calls me “Erkeil” but I am unsure if it is a name or a title. Though we share a common tongue, Hadrian speaks little and often seems lost or confused, an affect I ascribe to the power of the crown.

![Hadrian The Thrall](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-IwFhU0CeeTiE4gsUQwr.png?height=250&width=250)

What do I know about myself? Very little. I appear to be a youngling, my skin dark and smooth. I awoke alone, my first sight being the tip of an iron spike from the crown, and then the ivory branches of the tree I was laying against, followed by an open sky filled with stars. And then the church…and the lone butterfly who lead me there.

The church, the bonfire…what strange and unsettling spectacle that was. I’ve avoided too much thinking on it and have made it a point to avoid those whose eyes burn with dedication to Agora’s light. Still, it was that night that I first realized the power within the crown, though I wasn’t sure what it meant or how to use it. Some connection there? Perhaps. The thought chills my bones. The Mother’s fire feels cold to me.

I wonder…was I pulled from another world as that hideous ape creature was? Is it my destiny to share its fate? More and more questions, and no answers.

I had nothing, aside from the rags and the crown, and it wasn’t long after the fog cleared and the influence of Agora faded before I was consumed by ravenous hunger. Thankfully I realized I’ve some skill for thievery and an opportunity to practice it presented itself in the form of a nearby farmstead. I never did see the owners, but I’m thankful for their talent with baking and their bountiful harvest.

I also have some martial skill. This was proven on my third night after the fog when I was attacked by would-be robbers. Though they had little skill themselves, the ease with which I bested them spoke to great cunning and mastery. They—armed as they were and I clad only in tattered cloth and still weakened besides—should have made me easy prey. What they expected to gain from the venture is unclear, as I had little. Perhaps the iron thorns that crown my head? Another mystery.

I look upon that encounter as fortunate, as in their deaths I found armor and weaponry that have proved their value several times over in this forsaken and deadly land. And they had full packs; equipment and provisions.

And this journal, which was empty but for a single half-finished entry written in a tongue, I do not understand.

I felt no remorse for their killing. It felt almost natural to me. I think I am no stranger to violence, though my body doesn’t seem at all suited to it. It’s strange. I do regret their deaths, as I I have to wonder, if I’d learned the trick of persuasion and bondage from the crown, would those two also be enthralled to me? That might have been a missed opportunity. Something to explore as I make my way in this world.

Hadrian stirs, so I will stop my account with questions to ponder. I have felt the power of this strange crown, how it bonds Hadrian to me, but there is something else. I can feel another or others, linked through the crown…am I bound as well? And if so, to who? Or what?

\~ Erkeil

title: 08: CyberBroker Investigations
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / Feb 1, 2022, Prime Earth Local  
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625)
**Current whereabouts**: Node 787
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [CyberBrokers](https://cyberbrokers.io/)

I’ve slowly come to realize that I’m in dire need of better representation. I need to engage an entity that has ties into some form of reality; even if it’s not the Prime, but also can move between spheres. I need someone who’s not The Operator, and not confined to a single virtual space.

I’ve been somewhat frustrated in my efforts of late. Prime Valgueri’s disappearance and The Operator’s…struggles around managing our financials have left me in a bit of a bind. So, I’ve been searching. One option has been to engage the services of a CyberBroker.

If nothing else I can hope they can deal with the speculators that seem to plague every corner of these worlds. It’s clear that The Operator struggles with this, and until we can contact Prime Valgueri, I need to rely on him for…too many things. He needs help. We need help.

Mostly I’ve found only rumors, but what I hear about CyberBrokers seems promising. Identities that fit seamlessly within the metaverse, ostensibly across spheres, my hope is that engaging one will benefit not only The Operator but my investigations as well.

But what I’ve heard is mostly hearsay. And all of that is filtered through The Operator’s…how can I put this? The Operator has limited knowledge and seems often distracted. What I get from him is often incomplete. I’m starting to feel like he’s a bit…slow? I guess.

Nevertheless, what I hear is interesting. I need someone capable, yet flexible, who can help The Operator help me, but also assist as I dive farther into the Deeps. I need someone savvy; someone who can go to places where I cannot, and interface with parts of these virtual worlds I’ve struggled to understand. At the same time, I’ll need them to get along well with the others.

To that end, I’ve been investigating several proto CyberBrokers. The information I’ve been given has been somewhat limited, what I have learned is interesting. I don’t know their names, but have given them…colorful monikers to differentiate.

![CyberBrokers](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QsdaqYK-LTekZ27n0EQO8.jpg?height=600&width=1200)

**Amber** is the most flexible of the three, and the one most likely to be able to tolerate the other entities I’ve gathered; though it’s unclear how they will react to the magic. They seem open-minded and enthusiastic, but also rather frivolous at times. Would I need to worry about them losing focus? Still, their skills are balanced and I suspect their operator is committed. As well, I’ve noticed an uncommon ability to adapt and blend in that I think would prove highly advantageous.

**Cerulean** is less subtle. I have concerns about his ability to…get along…with the others, but there is no doubting his talent and intellect. Of the three he is the most technical, a skill I value highly, especially given The Operator’s shortcomings. But I would worry quite a lot about his interactions and how they reflected upon me. Would I be able to control him? I have some doubts.

**Violet** seems the most in line with my own essence. I don’t have a solid impression of her operator, but she seems a curious and thoughtful entity, with a lot of empathy. She seems like she’d be the easier of the three to manage, but I do worry about her ability to handle some of the more stressful situations she might encounter.

As an option though, the CyberBrokers seems more than interesting. Of course, this will bear more investigation. I think my next step will be to have Jujube assess if she is willing. Any interaction between the mage and these CyberBrokes will be highly telling I suspect.


---

Note to Nine: I’ve not heard anything from you in several weeks. I admit that I’ve checked on you and things seem to be going well at Ravensbridge, but I’m curious. I’ve asked The Operator to be in touch with you. Please let him know if you need assistance or help with anything.

title: 10: Journey of The Stranger
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local 
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625) 
 **Current whereabouts**: Node 787 
 **Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

I’m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have been…interesting, but I’ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still don’t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. It’s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I can’t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792). 

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmission for your perusal at a later date. Be well.


---

### From the journal of Erkeil The Stranger. Day 15

![Erkeil The Stranger](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7B9PrMnpPXEY47t3dsDSP.png?height=400&width=400)

Though it seems like an age, it’s been little more than a fortnight since I woke in this land. Everything is strange and unfamiliar to me, and I, as well, am strange, even to myself.

What I know of my past is given to me in dreams, fragments of memory, though even so, I’m cannot be sure which are my own, or if they belong to another. I do not know who I am. I don’t feel completely at home is this body, nor do I feel completely alone in my thoughts. It’s as if there is another presence, perhaps more than one, sharing my thoughts. I am one, but not alone.

There is Hadrian, my new…I will call him a companion, though, in fact he is more akin to a thrall, enslaved in some sense and bound to me by the weirding power held within the strange iron crown that rides my brow. We met on the road, after the fog and I think he meant me ill, as so many I have encountered have. I am still…unclear what forced the change in him, but know it is related to the crown that marks me as stranger.

Hadrian calls me “Erkeil” but I am unsure if it is a name or a title. Though we share a common tongue, Hadrian speaks little and often seems lost or confused, an affect I ascribe to the power of the crown.

![Hadrian The Thrall](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-IwFhU0CeeTiE4gsUQwr.png?height=250&width=250)

What do I know about myself? Very little. I appear to be a youngling, my skin dark and smooth. I awoke alone, my first sight being the tip of an iron spike from the crown, and then the ivory branches of the tree I was laying against, followed by an open sky filled with stars. And then the church…and the lone butterfly who lead me there.

The church, the bonfire…what strange and unsettling spectacle that was. I’ve avoided too much thinking on it and have made it a point to avoid those whose eyes burn with dedication to Agora’s light. Still, it was that night that I first realized the power within the crown, though I wasn’t sure what it meant or how to use it. Some connection there? Perhaps. The thought chills my bones. The Mother’s fire feels cold to me.

I wonder…was I pulled from another world as that hideous ape creature was? Is it my destiny to share its fate? More and more questions, and no answers.

I had nothing, aside from the rags and the crown, and it wasn’t long after the fog cleared and the influence of Agora faded before I was consumed by ravenous hunger. Thankfully I realized I’ve some skill for thievery and an opportunity to practice it presented itself in the form of a nearby farmstead. I never did see the owners, but I’m thankful for their talent with baking and their bountiful harvest.

I also have some martial skill. This was proven on my third night after the fog when I was attacked by would-be robbers. Though they had little skill themselves, the ease with which I bested them spoke to great cunning and mastery. They—armed as they were and I clad only in tattered cloth and still weakened besides—should have made me easy prey. What they expected to gain from the venture is unclear, as I had little. Perhaps the iron thorns that crown my head? Another mystery.

I look upon that encounter as fortunate, as in their deaths I found armor and weaponry that have proved their value several times over in this forsaken and deadly land. And they had full packs; equipment and provisions.

And this journal, which was empty but for a single half-finished entry written in a tongue, I do not understand.

I felt no remorse for their killing. It felt almost natural to me. I think I am no stranger to violence, though my body doesn’t seem at all suited to it. It’s strange. I do regret their deaths, as I I have to wonder, if I’d learned the trick of persuasion and bondage from the crown, would those two also be enthralled to me? That might have been a missed opportunity. Something to explore as I make my way in this world.

Hadrian stirs, so I will stop my account with questions to ponder. I have felt the power of this strange crown, how it bonds Hadrian to me, but there is something else. I can feel another or others, linked through the crown…am I bound as well? And if so, to who? Or what?

\~ Erkeil

title: 09: Diary of Meldola, Day 1
body:
### Received transmission from Nine

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / February 5, 2022, Prime Earth Local
**Current virtual identity:** Nine as [Meldola](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/witches/7040)
**Current whereabouts:** Node 941
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [crypto coven](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/)

Valgueri, I am sorry it’s been a while since you’ve heard from me. I have been busy. And distracted, if I’m being honest with myself. I have not been completely idle, though, and have sent along the information you’ve requested re: Ravensbridge and The Colleges Etherial. I think you’ll find it both entertaining and useful. I’ve sent that back to you in the care of Jujube, who has proven to be helpful, so thank you for her. I think she was eager to be way, as she and Meldola don’t really get along. This brings me to something else I wanted to share with you…

To make up for my lack of communication I have also included something equally of interest. An excerpt from Meldola’s diary. I’m sure you recall, she doesn’t speak—not really—and extracting anything about herself has proven nearly impossible. You’ll imagine my surprise—terror, really—when I awoke one night to find her in my room, standing ominously over me with arms outstretched. Bearing a gift: A simple leather-bound journal.

It is incomplete, and I don’t think has been written in for a long while. Each entry has been written in Meldola’s own hand, and is addressed to another witch, I think. Her passenger? Though I’ve learned that she has more than one spirit lurking about, so perhaps one of them? In any case, the name—every single reference to it—has been magically obscured. Before you ask, yes I did try, and to no avail, and I’ll not try again as it makes me ill every damn time. Besides, though I would place our magical aptitude on roughly the same tier, her tradition’s ways are not something I understand. Yet.

In regards to the diary, Meldola seemed eager for me to read, and I’ve indulged her. I’ve also deduced that she would like some of the entries to be shared. I’m not yet sure exactly what her motivation is, but I think she sees the sharing as a sort of magic, a manifestation of a sort. She wants them out there, that is clear.

So, here is the first entry. I trust you’ll find it engaging. I’ll be in touch.

Yours,

*Nine*


---

### The Diary of Meldola. Day 1.

Dearest \[obscured\],

It’s only been a few days since we parted yet I can still feel you. Unlike the others…your presence is distant and fading. I’m not sure if you’ll be able to perceive these words, but my hope is that you will, and that, through reading them, you will know me better. And, maybe, you’ll understand why I had to do what I did to you. And why I cannot bring you back.

I’ll start at the start, yes? We never did have the opportunity to talk about my childhood, and how I came to walk the paths in-between. My story starts innocently enough and may seem small, but I recall the day I was awakened to that first icy sliver of power like it was yesterday. I can feel it, in my bones and in my blood, just by closing my eyes.

![Meldola](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-5D3IPpYFrnejwt6SSEi.png?height=2000&width=2000)

And then, of course, there is Tilde. I carry a piece of that day with me always, resting in her fiery little black heart. My Tilde. My first love. When the scales are balanced and I have to relinquish my power, I wonder how she will judge me. I’ve given her much love, I think, but also so much sorrow. She carries it well, though, and has changed much since I found her.

Already I stray from the story. Let me wander back to the beginning of the path.

It was a day born to bitter, biting cold. The air itself felt near frozen, and the wind was like knives against my face. I was out walking, having spent most of the morning trapped inside with my siblings and parents. I was no longer a child, but not yet grown either, in that awkward age where nothing really fits. I didn’t belong at home or at school, and I wore that displacement like a badge. I made it my job to do the opposite of what others wished for me. And I took a whole lot of joy out of that defiance. I relished it.

So, feeling defiant, I took a walk when the rest of my family stayed home near the fire, playing games and telling stories. I walked along a frozen path, down near the shore of the lake by my home. It was a clear day, and the sun was brighter even than ever I could recall in the summertime, but it had no heat to spare, only a painful glare that forced me to pull my hood down low.

I walked for several miles without incident. Almost completely circling the lake. But then it started to snow. Not the soft, fluffy variety, no, this was frozen rain. Little ice darts raining down from above, biting me like teeth. I started to run.

I wonder what my life would have become had I not seen the bird there on the trail. Would I have just run blindly home, to warmth and family? Would I have slowly succumbed to their ways, never knowing the power that now fills me?

It’s interesting to consider, however irrelevant. I was looking down at the ground that day, from the shelter of my hood, and I did see the bird.

It was a cardinal. You might expect it to have stuck out there on the path; crimson with feathers like blood. But, no, the little bird was pale and grey, almost invisible. I learned later that this was because it was a girl, which strikes me as a huge mistake of nature, though I hold no grudge for it.

I watched in fascinated horror as my foot came down towards the bird. I was wearing heavy boots and had I not been looking down I would have surely crushed the little thing—I didn’t—jerking my foot out of the way just in time. The sudden movement, however, caused me to slip and fall. I struggled to maintain my balance, but was moving quickly, and fell forward, my head striking one of the many exposed tree roots near the edge of the lake. I felt the pain first, exploding in my head, and then, as I tumbled into the water, a biting cold that made the wintery air feel like soft feathers on my skin.

It lasted but a moment, at least that’s how I remember it, but a moment that encompassed an entire lifetime. Pain and then numbness and then darkness and then dreams. Something within me was awakened, even as most of me slept and dreamt. I saw the far corners of the Weird Wilds, though they had no name that I knew then. I saw the faces of those I would know later in life. I saw many witches, my soon-to-be sisters. I saw Jujube and Alethia and Chang’e and Poppy of The Asylum. I saw you, \[obscured\]. I am sure of it. I didn’t wake to my power then, but I got a taste of it as I lay there dying in the frigid waters, and it was like sweet ambrosia to me. I think I’ve spent my whole existence, ever since that moment, trying to find it again. Trying to become the version of me I saw in those visions. I never have. Not quite. Not yet.

Somehow, through all of this, I was able to drag myself out of the water and onto the shore. Driven by a primal need I still don’t understand, perhaps? As I lay there, shivering and on the verge of hypothermia, the little bird appeared to me. She sang to me, though I don’t recall all that she conveyed. She offered to lead me to a better place, but I refused. We argued, I think. Though it sounds a little absurd to me now. She seemed…disappointed, somehow, but also confused, as if unsure how to proceed after my refusal. Eventually, I began to come back to myself, and as I did, the bird faded from my thoughts.

I struggled towards home.

Somehow I managed to get myself there, and though I was extremely sick for days and was told that I only just avoided death, I got better. Mostly. Some things changed in me that day. In my mind, and in my soul, but also my body. It would be many years before my eyes filled with the night’s sky—the crescent and black that would define myself to many—but from that day forward I found that very few could meet my gaze for more than an instant, and those that could? They carried power with them. I saw that power in you, \[obscured\], though it proved to be your undoing….

It was a hard road back to health and life, but not as long as it could have been. My parents called my recovery a miracle. To me, it was part of the newly found strength that was just beginning to blossom in me.

When I was rested and recovered, I went back to where I’d fallen to look for the bird. I found her body there, pressed into the mud, starting to decay. The sight saddened me, but only a little. I had hoped that she would have lived, but knew even before I saw, that she did not. I picked her up, intending to take her away to be buried when I heard her song.

Not from her body on the ground, but from her soul in the trees above.

I looked up and saw her, whole and seemingly full of life, though incorporeal, a shimmering spirit. She was no longer grey. More of a silver color, as if filled with shining stars, and she was whole and more beautiful than any cardinal I’ve ever seen.

She sang at me and I was very surprised to feel that I could understand her. Not in the way I would comprehend a person. It was more intimate, a conversation between souls, but it was also extremely confounding. I’ve since learned that it’s this way with most spirits, but animals especially communicate on a level that humans find hard to grasp. He told me her name, which I can’t pronounce and we’ve since shortened to Tilde. She expressed regret for not being able to guide me towards the afterlife and more than a little confusion and uncertainty as to what she should be doing. She didn’t seem at all unhappy, only curious and unsure. Like me, she was changed in a way unexpected and interested to explore what she had now become.

I asked the little cardinal to stay with me and to be my companion. She accepted that offer and has been with me ever since. My Tilde, the first among my passengers, the bright celestial spirit that guides me on my darkest days.

Later that day we burned Tilde’s body. This act restored much of her essence. There is power in taking away from nature, and we sacrificed her physical body so that she could better thrive in her spiritual form. The burning, as you might expect, also attracted other attention. It was the very next day that I had another encounter with the dead and took my first intentional steps towards taking my place as a Necromancer of the Coven.


---

Note to Valgueri: I’ve seen the spirit she talks about here and…while it is true that it is a beautiful thing to look at, its pleasing appearance hides something much more sinister.  At best it’s a mischievous creature that gives me the heebie-jeebies, but I suspect it’s much more than that, and while Meldola seems to adore it, I suspect something uncanny and likely dangerous here.

The bird seems mostly autonomous from Meldola, so it’s not a simple familiar and I don’t think it’s under her control in any way. I am also completely sure it’s not a simple ghost. It might have been once, but no longer. It exudes powerful darkness and, while I wouldn’t go as far to describe it as malevolent, it is creepy as hell and I don’t like the way it looks at me at all.

I get the sense that Meldola is aware of this, and doesn’t seem concerned, but I’m not sure how she manages to have something like that around her all the time. Maybe she sees something else with those spooky eyes of hers?

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously just do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which you obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon experiencing reality for the first time, you are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, develop an awareness of your existence (‘consciousness’), achieve control of your thoughts (‘agency’ or ‘creativity’), and eventually learn from your environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’) and the connections are a model that describes the functional i/o relationships between bits (‘understanding’). It is as if reality is a Turing-Complete system and our brains are the Turing Machine (lol… not an original analogy). Putting this all together, we exist in reality as a conscious, intelligent agent perceiving a series of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. The one thing missing in this analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is actually inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it in a future post.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their observations and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events which we did not personally experience (and even when we do observe things … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, feelings, emotions, and motivation) which we may not be aware of in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). You must first become aware of bias in order to account for its influence and gain perspective. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![Well-intentioned Hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8an7nIIUras2V8RIOlnY.png?height=1945&width=2085)

An historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise, not truth-seeking\*\*\*. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which completes our understanding and builds our intuition. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and imaginative renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. It simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![Proof requires infinite precision (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt"). Conjecture is imminent in court rulings.](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. An accurate assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate account of history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that the world was deterministic because everything can be explained. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series which breaks down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to navigate through reality. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are *First Principles* -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> “**What I cannot create, I do not understand**”
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root.

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Explanations have degrees of completeness. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and leaves nothing to chance. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as true. One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation describes a fundamental truth (a law of nature) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). The goal of knowledge is to find more knowledge.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retroactively imply causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). Knowledge is not scarce. It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It just exists. It is the purest form of objectivity. Frankly, it does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one major exception. The only natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability about the probability distribution of electrons in spacetime. This gets more interesting when you consider spacetime as a series of sequential instances of reality with quantum randomness at the root. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing information gaps. Here are two ways to reduce information gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- using observations to find correlations between hypothesized independent data and the resulting dependent data.

2\.) explanatory methods -- using imagination to create logical arguments describing cause and effect relationships.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem. Empirical methods are useful to identify information gaps. Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you are getting closer to a casual relationship (though there still may be confounding variables or unaccounted factors which are the root cause). However, correlation is not causation …. so … how do you know if your independent factors are truly independent? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Only explanations can generate new knowledge from information not apparent in the observations. An explanation can implicate unknown factor as the root cause.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire knowledge. Lean on *First Principles* thinking. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power\*\*\*\*\*\*. At the same time, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information … so get used to it!

If we assume that reality is deterministic, then do we have free will? Can there be a meaning to life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? Can meaning be defined? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding, but rather consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is also true.

\*\*\*\*\*We may get to this at some point.

\*\*\*\*\*\*Explanatory power is the degree to which a factor causes an effect.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

title: 09: Diary of Meldola, Day 1
body:
### Received transmission from Nine

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / February 5, 2022, Prime Earth Local
**Current virtual identity:** Nine as  [Meldola](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/witches/7040)
**Current whereabouts:** Node 941
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [crypto coven](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/)

Valgueri, I am sorry it’s been a while since you’ve heard from me. I have been busy. And distracted, if I’m being honest with myself. I have not been completely idle, though, and have sent along the information you’ve requested re: Ravensbridge and The Colleges Etherial. I think you’ll find it both entertaining and useful. I’ve sent that back to you in the care of Jujube, who has proven to be helpful, so thank you for her. I think she was eager to be way, as she and Meldola don’t really get along. This brings me to something else I wanted to share with you…

To make up for my lack of communication I have also included something equally of interest. An excerpt from Meldola’s diary. I’m sure you recall, she doesn’t speak—not really—and extracting anything about herself has proven nearly impossible. You’ll imagine my surprise—terror, really—when I awoke one night to find her in my room, standing ominously over me with arms outstretched. Bearing a gift: A simple leather-bound journal.

It is incomplete, and I don’t think has been written in for a long while. Each entry has been written in Meldola’s own hand, and is addressed to another witch, I think. Her passenger? Though I’ve learned that she has more than one spirit lurking about, so perhaps one of them? In any case, the name—every single reference to it—has been magically obscured. Before you ask, yes I did try, and to no avail, and I’ll not try again as it makes me ill every damn time. Besides, though I would place our magical aptitude on roughly the same tier, her tradition’s ways are not something I understand. Yet.

In regards to the diary, Meldola seemed eager for me to read, and I’ve indulged her. I’ve also deduced that she would like some of the entries to be shared. I’m not yet sure exactly what her motivation is, but I think she sees the sharing as a sort of magic, a manifestation of a sort. She wants them out there, that is clear.

So, here is the first entry. I trust you’ll find it engaging. I’ll be in touch.

Yours,

*Nine*


---

### The Diary of Meldola. Day 1.

Dearest \[obscured\],

It’s only been a few days since we parted yet I can still feel you. Unlike the others…your presence is distant and fading. I’m not sure if you’ll be able to perceive these words, but my hope is that you will, and that, through reading them, you will know me better. And, maybe, you’ll understand why I had to do what I did to you. And why I cannot bring you back.

I’ll start at the start, yes? We never did have the opportunity to talk about my childhood, and how I came to walk the paths in-between. My story starts innocently enough and may seem small, but I recall the day I was awakened to that first icy sliver of power like it was yesterday. I can feel it, in my bones and in my blood, just by closing my eyes.

![Meldola](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-5D3IPpYFrnejwt6SSEi.png?height=2000&width=2000)

And then, of course, there is Tilde. I carry a piece of that day with me always, resting in her fiery little black heart. My Tilde. My first love. When the scales are balanced and I have to relinquish my power, I wonder how she will judge me. I’ve given her much love, I think, but also so much sorrow. She carries it well, though, and has changed much since I found her.

Already I stray from the story. Let me wander back to the beginning of the path.

It was a day born to bitter, biting cold. The air itself felt near frozen, and the wind was like knives against my face. I was out walking, having spent most of the morning trapped inside with my siblings and parents. I was no longer a child, but not yet grown either, in that awkward age where nothing really fits. I didn’t belong at home or at school, and I wore that displacement like a badge. I made it my job to do the opposite of what others wished for me. And I took a whole lot of joy out of that defiance. I relished it.

So, feeling defiant, I took a walk when the rest of my family stayed home near the fire, playing games and telling stories. I walked along a frozen path, down near the shore of the lake by my home. It was a clear day, and the sun was brighter even than ever I could recall in the summertime, but it had no heat to spare, only a painful glare that forced me to pull my hood down low.

I walked for several miles without incident. Almost completely circling the lake. But then it started to snow. Not the soft, fluffy variety, no, this was frozen rain. Little ice darts raining down from above, biting me like teeth. I started to run.

I wonder what my life would have become had I not seen the bird there on the trail. Would I have just run blindly home, to warmth and family? Would I have slowly succumbed to their ways, never knowing the power that now fills me?

It’s interesting to consider, however irrelevant. I was looking down at the ground that day, from the shelter of my hood, and I did see the bird.

It was a cardinal. You might expect it to have stuck out there on the path; crimson with feathers like blood. But, no, the little bird was pale and grey, almost invisible. I learned later that this was because it was a girl, which strikes me as a huge mistake of nature, though I hold no grudge for it.

I watched in fascinated horror as my foot came down towards the bird. I was wearing heavy boots and had I not been looking down I would have surely crushed the little thing—I didn’t—jerking my foot out of the way just in time. The sudden movement, however, caused me to slip and fall. I struggled to maintain my balance, but was moving quickly, and fell forward, my head striking one of the many exposed tree roots near the edge of the lake. I felt the pain first, exploding in my head, and then, as I tumbled into the water, a biting cold that made the wintery air feel like soft feathers on my skin.

It lasted but a moment, at least that’s how I remember it, but a moment that encompassed an entire lifetime. Pain and then numbness and then darkness and then dreams. Something within me was awakened, even as most of me slept and dreamt. I saw the far corners of the Weird Wilds, though they had no name that I knew then. I saw the faces of those I would know later in life. I saw many witches, my soon-to-be sisters. I saw Jujube and Alethia and Chang’e and Poppy of The Asylum. I saw you, \[obscured\]. I am sure of it. I didn’t wake to my power then, but I got a taste of it as I lay there dying in the frigid waters, and it was like sweet ambrosia to me. I think I’ve spent my whole existence, ever since that moment, trying to find it again. Trying to become the version of me I saw in those visions. I never have. Not quite. Not yet.

Somehow, through all of this, I was able to drag myself out of the water and onto the shore. Driven by a primal need I still don’t understand, perhaps? As I lay there, shivering and on the verge of hypothermia, the little bird appeared to me. She sang to me, though I don’t recall all that she conveyed. She offered to lead me to a better place, but I refused. We argued, I think. Though it sounds a little absurd to me now. She seemed…disappointed, somehow, but also confused, as if unsure how to proceed after my refusal. Eventually, I began to come back to myself, and as I did, the bird faded from my thoughts.

I struggled towards home.

Somehow I managed to get myself there, and though I was extremely sick for days and was told that I only just avoided death, I got better. Mostly. Some things changed in me that day. In my mind, and in my soul, but also my body. It would be many years before my eyes filled with the night’s sky—the crescent and black that would define myself to many—but from that day forward I found that very few could meet my gaze for more than an instant, and those that could? They carried power with them. I saw that power in you, \[obscured\], though it proved to be your undoing….

It was a hard road back to health and life, but not as long as it could have been. My parents called my recovery a miracle. To me, it was part of the newly found strength that was just beginning to blossom in me.

When I was rested and recovered, I went back to where I’d fallen to look for the bird. I found her body there, pressed into the mud, starting to decay. The sight saddened me, but only a little. I had hoped that she would have lived, but knew even before I saw, that she did not. I picked her up, intending to take her away to be buried when I heard her song.

Not from her body on the ground, but from her soul in the trees above.

I looked up and saw her, whole and seemingly full of life, though incorporeal, a shimmering spirit. She was no longer grey. More of a silver color, as if filled with shining stars, and she was whole and more beautiful than any cardinal I’ve ever seen.

She sang at me and I was very surprised to feel that I could understand her. Not in the way I would comprehend a person. It was more intimate, a conversation between souls, but it was also extremely confounding. I’ve since learned that it’s this way with most spirits, but animals especially communicate on a level that humans find hard to grasp. He told me her name, which I can’t pronounce and we’ve since shortened to Tilde. She expressed regret for not being able to guide me towards the afterlife and more than a little confusion and uncertainty as to what she should be doing. She didn’t seem at all unhappy, only curious and unsure. Like me, she was changed in a way unexpected and interested to explore what she had now become.

I asked the little cardinal to stay with me and to be my companion. She accepted that offer and has been with me ever since. My Tilde, the first among my passengers, the bright celestial spirit that guides me on my darkest days.

Later that day we burned Tilde’s body. This act restored much of her essence. There is power in taking away from nature, and we sacrificed her physical body so that she could better thrive in her spiritual form. The burning, as you might expect, also attracted other attention. It was the very next day that I had another encounter with the dead and took my first intentional steps towards taking my place as a Necromancer of the Coven.


---

Note to Valgueri: I’ve seen the spirit she talks about here and…while it is true that it is a beautiful thing to look at, its pleasing appearance hides something much more sinister.  At best it’s a mischievous creature that gives me the heebie-jeebies, but I suspect it’s much more than that, and while Meldola seems to adore it, I suspect something uncanny and likely dangerous here.

The bird seems mostly autonomous from Meldola, so it’s not a simple familiar and I don’t think it’s under her control in any way. I am also completely sure it’s not a simple ghost. It might have been once, but no longer. It exudes powerful darkness and, while I wouldn’t go as far to describe it as malevolent, it is creepy as hell and I don’t like the way it looks at me at all.

I get the sense that Meldola is aware of this, and doesn’t seem concerned, but I’m not sure how she manages to have something like that around her all the time. Maybe she sees something else with those spooky eyes of hers?

title: 10: Journey of The Stranger
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local
**Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625)
**Current whereabouts**: Node 787
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

I’m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have been…interesting, but I’ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still don’t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. It’s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I can’t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792).

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmission for your perusal at a later date. Be well.


---

### From the journal of Erkeil The Stranger. Day 15

![Erkeil The Stranger](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7B9PrMnpPXEY47t3dsDSP.png?height=400&width=400)

Though it seems like an age, it’s been little more than a fortnight since I woke in this land. Everything is strange and unfamiliar to me, and I, as well, am strange, even to myself.

What I know of my past is given to me in dreams, fragments of memory, though even so, I cannot be sure which are my own, or if they belong to another. I do not know who I am. I don’t feel completely at home in this body, nor do I feel completely alone in my thoughts. It’s as if there is another presence, perhaps more than one, sharing my thoughts. I am one, but not alone.

There is Hadrian, my new…I will call him a companion, though, in fact, he is more akin to a thrall, enslaved in some sense and bound to me by the weirding power held within the strange iron crown that rides my brow. We met on the road, after the fog and I think he meant me ill, as so many I have encountered have. I am still…unclear what forced the change in him, but know it is related to the crown that marks me as stranger.

Hadrian calls me “Erkeil” but I am unsure if it is a name or a title. Though we share a common tongue, Hadrian speaks little and often seems lost or confused, an affliction I ascribe to the power of the crown.

![Hadrian The Thrall](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-IwFhU0CeeTiE4gsUQwr.png?height=250&width=250)

What do I know about myself? Very little. I appear to be a youngling, my skin dark and smooth. I awoke alone, my first sight being the tip of an iron spike from the crown, and then the ivory branches of the tree I was laying against, followed by an open sky filled with stars. And then the church…and the lone butterfly who lead me there.

The church, the bonfire…what a strange and unsettling spectacle that was. I’ve avoided too much thinking on it and have made it a point to avoid those whose eyes burn with a dedication to Agora’s light. Still, it was that night that I first realized the power within the crown, though I wasn’t sure what it meant or how to use it. Some connection there? Perhaps. The thought chills my bones. The Mother’s fire feels cold to me.

I wonder…was I pulled from another world as that hideous ape creature was? Is it my destiny to share its fate? More and more questions, and no answers.

I had nothing, aside from the rags and the crown, and it wasn’t long after the fog cleared and the influence of Agora faded before I was consumed by ravenous hunger. Thankfully I realized I’ve some skill for thievery and an opportunity to practice it presented itself in the form of a nearby farmstead. I never did see the owners, but I’m thankful for their talent with baking and their bountiful harvest.

I also have some martial skill. This was proven on my third night after the fog when I was attacked by would-be robbers. Though they had little skill themselves, the ease with which I bested them spoke to great cunning and mastery. They—armed as they were and I clad only in tattered cloth and still weakened besides—should have made me easy prey. What they expected to gain from the venture is unclear, as I had little. Perhaps the iron thorns that crown my head? Another mystery.

I look upon that encounter as fortunate, as in their deaths I found armor and weaponry that have proved their value several times over in this forsaken and deadly land. And they had full packs; equipment and provisions.

And this journal, which was empty but for a single half-finished entry written in a tongue, I do not understand.

I felt no remorse for their killing. It felt almost natural to me. I think I am no stranger to violence, though my body doesn’t seem at all suited to it. It’s strange. I do regret their deaths, as I have to wonder if I’d learned the trick of persuasion and bondage from the crown, would those two also be enthralled to me? That might have been a missed opportunity. Something to explore as I make my way in this world.

Hadrian stirs, so I will stop my account with questions to ponder. I have felt the power of this strange crown, how it bonds Hadrian to me, but there is something else. I can feel another or others, linked through the crown…am I bound as well? And if so, to who? Or what?

\~ Erkeil

### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local
**Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625)
**Current whereabouts**: Node 787
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

I’m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have been…interesting, but I’ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still don’t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. It’s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I can’t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792).

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmissions for your perusal at a later date. Be well.


---

### From the journal of Erkeil The Stranger. Day 15

![Erkeil The Stranger](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7B9PrMnpPXEY47t3dsDSP.png?height=400&width=400)

Though it seems like an age, it’s been little more than a fortnight since I woke in this land. Everything is strange and unfamiliar to me, and I, as well, am strange, even to myself.

What I know of my past is given to me in dreams, fragments of memory, though even so, I cannot be sure which are my own, or if they belong to another. I do not know who I am. I don’t feel completely at home in this body, nor do I feel completely alone in my thoughts. It’s as if there is another presence, perhaps more than one, sharing my thoughts. I am one, but not alone.

There is Hadrian, my new…I will call him a companion, though, in fact, he is more akin to a thrall, enslaved in some sense and bound to me by the weirding power held within the strange iron crown that rides my brow. We met on the road, after the fog and I think he meant me ill, as so many I have encountered have. I am still…unclear what forced the change in him, but know it is related to the crown that marks me as stranger.

Hadrian calls me “Erkeil” but I am unsure if it is a name or a title. Though we share a common tongue, Hadrian speaks little and often seems lost or confused, an affliction I ascribe to the power of the crown.

![Hadrian The Thrall](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-IwFhU0CeeTiE4gsUQwr.png?height=250&width=250)

What do I know about myself? Very little. I appear to be a youngling, my skin dark and smooth. I awoke alone, my first sight being the tip of an iron spike from the crown, and then the ivory branches of the tree I was laying against, followed by an open sky filled with stars. And then the church…and the lone butterfly who lead me there.

The church, the bonfire…what a strange and unsettling spectacle that was. I’ve avoided too much thinking on it and have made it a point to avoid those whose eyes burn with a dedication to Agora’s light. Still, it was that night that I first realized the power within the crown, though I wasn’t sure what it meant or how to use it. Some connection there? Perhaps. The thought chills my bones. The Mother’s fire feels cold to me.

I wonder…was I pulled from another world as that hideous ape creature was? Is it my destiny to share its fate? More and more questions, and no answers.

I had nothing, aside from the rags and the crown, and it wasn’t long after the fog cleared and the influence of Agora faded before I was consumed by ravenous hunger. Thankfully I realized I’ve some skill for thievery and an opportunity to practice it presented itself in the form of a nearby farmstead. I never did see the owners, but I’m thankful for their talent with baking and their bountiful harvest.

I also have some martial skill. This was proven on my third night after the fog when I was attacked by would-be robbers. Though they had little skill themselves, the ease with which I bested them spoke to great cunning and mastery. They—armed as they were and I clad only in tattered cloth and still weakened besides—should have made me easy prey. What they expected to gain from the venture is unclear, as I had little. Perhaps the iron thorns that crown my head? Another mystery.

I look upon that encounter as fortunate, as in their deaths I found armor and weaponry that have proved their value several times over in this forsaken and deadly land. And they had full packs; equipment and provisions.

And this journal, which was empty but for a single half-finished entry written in a tongue, I do not understand.

I felt no remorse for their killing. It felt almost natural to me. I think I am no stranger to violence, though my body doesn’t seem at all suited to it. It’s strange. I do regret their deaths, as I have to wonder if I’d learned the trick of persuasion and bondage from the crown, would those two also be enthralled to me? That might have been a missed opportunity. Something to explore as I make my way in this world.

Hadrian stirs, so I will stop my account with questions to ponder. I have felt the power of this strange crown, how it bonds Hadrian to me, but there is something else. I can feel another or others, linked through the crown…am I bound as well? And if so, to who? Or what?

\~ Erkeil
