title: Insanity
body:
The term *logos*, the root word of "logic," refers to the sum total of our rational understanding of the world. *Mythos* is the sum total of the early historic and prehistoric  myths which preceded the logos. The mythos includes not only the Greek myths but the Old Testament, the Vedic Hymns and the early legends of all cultures which have contributed to our present world understanding. The mythos-over-logos argument states that our rationality is shaped by these legends, that **our knowledge today is in relation to these legends as a tree is in relation to the little shrub it once was.** One can gain great insights into the complex overall structure of the tree by studying the much simpler shape of the shrub. There's no difference in kind or even difference in identity, only a difference in size.

Thus, in cultures whose ancestry includes ancient Greece, one invariably finds a strong subject-object differentiation because the grammar of the old Greek mythos presumed a sharp natural division of subjects and predicates. In cultures such as the Chinese, where subject-predicate relationships are not rigidly defined by grammar, one finds a corresponding absence of rigid subject-object philosophy. One finds that in the Western Christian culture, in which the Biblical “Word" has an intrinsic sacredness of its own, men are willing to sacrifice and live by and die for words. In this culture, a court of law can ask a witness to tell "the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help me God” and expect the truth to be told. But one can transport this court to Liberia, as was attempted in the 1800s, with no sustainable success on the matter of law and order because the Liberian mythos is inherently different and this sacredness of words is not felt in the same way. Similar problems have occurred in America among minority groups with different cultural backgrounds. There are endless examples of how mythos differences direct behavioral differences and they're all fascinating.

The mythos-over-logos argument points to the idea that each child is born ignorant, and what keeps the world from reverting to this ignorance with each generation is the continuing, ongoing mythos - transformed into logos but still mythos - the huge body of common knowledge that unites our minds as cells are united in the body of man. To feel that one is not so united, that one can accept or discard this mythos as one pleases, is not to understand what the mythos is. There is only one kind of person who accepts or rejects the mythos in which he lives. And the definition of that person, when he has rejected the mythos, is "insane." **To step outside the mythos is to become insane.** The relation of mythos to insanity is this: insanity is the *terra incognita* surrounding the mythos.

The \[UNDEFINED\] you seek lay outside the mythos. Why? Because \[UNDEFINED\] *is the generator of the mythos itself.* That's it. That's what is meant by, "\[UNDEFINED\] is the continuing stimulus which causes us to create the world in which we live. All of it. Every last bit of it.” Religion isn't invented by man. Men are invented by religion. Men invent responses to \[UNDEFINED\], and **among these responses is an understanding of what they themselves are.** You know something and then the \[UNDEFINED\] stimulus hits and then you try to define the \[UNDEFINED\] stimulus, but to define it all you've got to work with is what you know. So your definition is made up of what you know. It's an analogue to what you already know. It has to be. It can't be anything else. The mythos grows this way, by analogies to what is known before. The mythos is a building of analogues upon analogues upon analogues. These fill the boxcars of the train of consciousness. The mythos is the whole train of collective consciousness of all communicating mankind. Every last bit of it. The \[UNDEFINED\] is the track that directs the train. What is outside the train, to either side: the *terra incognita* of the insane. To truly see the path \[UNDEFINED\] leads us, you have to leave the train. You must step outside the mythos. You must go insane.

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously just do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which you obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon experiencing reality for the first time, you are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, develop an awareness of your existence (‘consciousness’), achieve control of your thoughts (‘agency’ or ‘creativity’), and eventually learn from your environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’) and the connections are a model that describes the functional i/o relationships between bits (‘understanding’). It is as if reality is a Turing-Complete system and our brains are the Turing Machine (lol… not an original analogy). Putting this all together, we exist in reality as a conscious, intelligent agent perceiving a series of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. The one thing missing in this analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is actually inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it in a future post.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their observations and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events which we did not personally experience (and even when we do observe things … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, feelings, emotions, and motivation) which we may not be aware of in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). You must first become aware of bias in order to account for its influence and gain perspective. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![Well-intentioned Hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8an7nIIUras2V8RIOlnY.png?height=1945&width=2085)

An historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise, not truth-seeking\*\*\*. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and imaginative renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. It simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![Proof requires infinite precision (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt"). Conjecture is imminent in court rulings.](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. An accurate assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate account of history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that the world was deterministic because everything can be explained. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series which breaks down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to navigate through reality. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are *First Principles* -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> “**What I cannot create, I do not understand**”
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root.

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Explanations have degrees of completeness. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and leaves nothing to chance. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as true. One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation describes a fundamental truth (a law of nature) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). The goal of knowledge is to find more knowledge.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retroactively imply causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). Knowledge is not scarce. It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It just exists. It is the purest form of objectivity. Frankly, it does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one major exception. The only natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability about the probability distribution of electrons in spacetime. This gets more interesting when you consider spacetime as a series of sequential instances of reality with quantum randomness at the root. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing information gaps. Here are two ways to reduce information gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- using observations to find correlations between hypothesized independent data and the resulting dependent data.

2\.) explanatory methods -- using imagination to create logical arguments describing cause and effect relationships.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem. Empirical methods are useful to identify information gaps. Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you are getting closer to a casual relationship (though there still may be confounding variables or unaccounted factors which are the root cause). However, correlation is not causation …. so … how do you know if your independent factors are truly independent? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Only explanations can generate new knowledge from information not apparent in the observations. An explanation can implicate unknown factor as the root cause.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire knowledge. Lean on *First Principles* thinking. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power\*\*\*\*\*\*. At the same time, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information … so get used to it!

If we assume that reality is deterministic, then do we have free will? Can there be a meaning to life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? Can meaning be defined? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding, but rather consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is also true.

\*\*\*\*\*We may get to this at some point.

\*\*\*\*\*\*Explanatory power is the degree to which a factor causes an effect.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

title: 《区块链技术与应用》13 ETH以太坊 权益证明（PoS）
body:
**这个系列的内容是根据肖臻老师《区块链技术与应用》公开课的内容进行的内容整理，以及部分延伸的思考。文末附有公开课链接。**

**课程基于18年5月的版本所讲述，但是对理解最近（2022.6）讨论很多的ETH 2.0有很大的帮助。本篇主要回答以5个问题：**

1、权益证明（PoS）和工作量证明（PoW）的含义，以及区别是什么？

2、PoS的优点是什么？缺点是什么？

3、以太坊的Casper协议是如何规避PoS的缺点的？有什么其他衍生的风险吗？

4、以太坊为什么没有一开始就使用PoS？

5、行业中直接使用PoS的案例和具体做法？有什么潜在的风险？ 
 

### 权益证明Proof of Stake（PoS）

**Proof of work有一个弊端：能耗高**

2018年的数据：比特币一年的用电量相当于智利一年的能耗，一年69.95Twh(10的12次方)，电费成本占比一半左右，一个交易要花一千度电，一年能耗占全球电能消耗的0.31%。

以太坊一个交易消耗67度电，主要是因为出块时间短。

2018年的数据，比特币加以太坊当做一个国家，在全球耗电排名30多名。

**问题1：矿工为什么要挖矿？**
为了取得收益。

**问题2：为什么要给他们收益？**
为了激励矿工参与区块链的维护，不然没有动力参与。

**问题3：如何参与挖矿？**
买设备，投入。

**问题4：收益大小如何决定？**
收益由算力大小决定。算力大小由设备投入决定，往后追溯就是资本能力。

**问题5：为什么大家还要挖矿？为什么不直接投钱？** 

直接投钱，用权益证明，不直接参与挖矿。

Blockchain is secured by mining. 但是mining的设备是由外界的资本投入购买的。 如果一个组织在实际世界很有钱，可以转换成挖矿的设备投入，这样的群体就非常容易发动攻击。 使用工作量证明的区块链，维护安全的过程，不是一个闭环，外部世界的资源会影响这点。

既然最终是拼钱，为什么不直接把钱拿出来比一比？现在是矿工通过竞争算力来决定挖矿的收益如何分配，能不能改成直接比钱的多少来比拼？将来按照每个人投入资金的比例分配利润。权益证明也是虚拟挖矿，virtual mining。

采用权益证明的加密货币会在正式发行前预留一部分给开发者，售出一部分货币换取开发资金。按照权益证明的共识机制，每个人都是按照持有货币的数量来进行投票。

基于工作量证明的共识系统，维护区块链安全的资源不是一个闭环，挖矿设备是用美元购买的，是从加密货币的生态系统外面得到的。虽然加密货币总市值增加很多，但是和世界经济总市值相比还是微乎其微，所以发动恶意的组织只要有足够的资金购买挖矿设备，聚集到加密货币一半以上的总算力就可以成功攻击。早期发行的加密货币是最容易被攻击的，Altcoin是指除了比特币之外的小的币种，Altcoin Infantcide扼杀在摇篮里。

### 权益证明的优点

* 好处1、省去挖矿过程，节省能耗
* 好处2、发动攻击只能从内部获取，外部的资源不能直接转换成攻击的资源。需要从内部购买。如果有人想要发动攻击，大量购买一个货币，就会出现价格的快速上升，类似股市的恶意收购。会被发现，因为权益证明是在内部闭环的。

权益证明和工作量证明并不是互斥的，有的加密货币采用的是一种混合模型，还是要挖矿的，但是挖矿的难度是和你持有的币的权益是相关的，币越多，挖矿越容易。这样设计的话，系统中拥有最多币的矿工每次挖矿都是最容易的，所以有的加密货币要求投入的币使用之后会被锁定一段时间，这个操作也叫Proof of Deposit。

### 权益证明的缺点

两边下注问题Nothing at stake（无利害关系），两边都下注，使用权益证明没有损失。工作量证明会有算力损失。但是权益证明没有。

这样会使得分叉攻击、双花攻击变得更容易。

### 以太坊的权益证明协议---Casper协议

Casper the Friendly Finality Gadget 

**核心是设置了一个Validator验证者的角色，需要投入一定的以太币。** 

Two-phase commit；Prepare message和Commit message

 过渡阶段也是要和工作量证明混合使用，为工作量证明提供finality，Finality是一个最终的状态，包含在Finality中的交易不会被取消，单纯基于工作量证明的交易是有可能被回滚的，交易被写入区块链之后，有人从前面开始分叉挖出更长的区块链，原来的交易就无效了，比特币规定等六个确认区块，这只是说六个区块之后被回滚的概率非常小了，如果有人集中算力超过50%，还是有可能会回滚之前的交易，所以单纯基于挖矿的区块链是缺乏finality。

**Casper协议是怎么做的呢？引入一个概念叫做Validator，验证者，成为validator必须要投入一定量的以太币作为保证金，保证金会被系统锁定，validator 的职责是推动系统达成共识，投票决定哪条链是最长合法链，投票的权重取决于保证金的数目大小。**

具体做法有点类似数据库里面的two phase commit，挖矿的时候每挖出一百个区块作为一个epoch，决定这个能不能成为finality，要进行投票，分两轮投票。

实际系统中有所改变，100个区块变成了50个区块，每个epoch只用一轮投票，这一轮投票对于上一个epoch来说是commit message，对于下一个epoch来说是Prepare message，连续两轮投票两个epoch都得到2/3以上的投票才算有效。

 两轮投票三分之二通过，就是有效，验证者工作有出块奖励，验证者不作为，扣保证金，乱投票没收保证金，直接销毁，每个验证者有一定的任期，有个等待期，过了之后取回保证金和奖励。

**为什么一开始不用权益证明？**
权益证明早期不成熟。工作量证明比较成熟。比特币和早期的以太坊都经过了Bug bounty

**Q: Casper协议可以给挖矿挖出的区块链的某种状态做一个检查点完成某种状态作为一个检查点，checkpoint，那这个point是不是绝对安全，换句话说通过验证者投票达成的finality有没有可能被推翻？**

有恶意的矿工没有验证者作为同伙是不可能攻击成功，但是如果有大量的验证者两边下注，给前后有冲突的finality都下注，协议要求每轮投票2/3以上的验证者支持才能通过，如果出现攻击，则至少有1/3的验证者两边都投票，一旦发现这些验证者的保证金将被没收。

挖矿工作量证明得到的奖励越来越少，就可以逐渐从PoW转移到PoS。

但是PoS目前技术还不够纯熟，18年上线的EOS，完全用的权益证明，用的不是casper协议，用的DPOS协议，投票选出21个超级节点，产出区块。

**挖矿消耗资源的反面观点**
电很难传输，很难存储，挖矿提供了一种把电能转换成钱的方式。把多余的电能转换成加密货币。存储传输都不是问题，只要保管好私钥即可。

title: 买了NFT就能随便用来代言吗？
body:
熊市里，NFT投机者Alice自动变成了NFT收藏者和Builder。除了持续在所持有的NFT社区中进行推广之外，Alice也想为手中的“小图片”寻求新的商业价值。Bob有一家自创的消费品品牌，目前想在Web3和元宇宙里寻找新生代代言人。Alice是否能将手里的NFT授权Bob成为联名款商品？这背后会不会有版权问题呢？\\

实际上，将NFT用于品牌推广已经有成功的案例，比如我们熟知的运动潮牌中国李宁和NFT蓝筹项目BAYC，李宁在买入BAYC#4102之后，就以该NFT的形象为蓝本发售了“中国李宁无聊猿潮流运动俱乐部”系列产品，还打造了一个BAYC#4102的巨型像素化雕塑举办了一场“无聊不无聊”为主题的快闪活动，吸引了一大波关注科技潮流的年轻人，也带着NFT狠狠地出了一次圈。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g8P1R_qyMS2JzAt9DL1Z4.png?height=640&width=640)

但并非所有NFT项目都是这样，本文将以市场上几个蓝筹项目为例，分析NFT中各种权利的区别、NFT商用过程中可能遇到的风险、持有者该如何运用NFT赋予的权益等。

**观点提炼**

* 买了一个NFT≠可以随意商用，因为NFT跟NFT上的图片不是一回事；
* 买了Azuki可能碰到合法的“撞Logo”，因为Azuki的图片商业授权不排他；
* 有的NFT买来就能商用，有的需要先授权，也有的禁止商用，这取决于发行方的授权方式；
* 品牌主寻找NFT的合作需要先搞清楚该NFT商业权利的归属；
* 目前NFT的商业条款缺乏有公信力的背书，存在发行方篡改的风险 

## 1 

**为什么我买了BAYC之后，Yuga Labs 还能继续用我的NFT进行宣传推广？**

在回答这个问题之前，需要先区别两个概念，**NFT与NFT上所承载的艺术作品（NFT ART），是两个不同的概念，代表着不同的权利。**

以图片NFT为例，**NFT仅仅是图片在区块链网络中的权属证明，不一定包含图片（NFT ART）及其附着的知识产权，也就是拥有NFT并不一定同时拥有对应的知识产权。**

对于NFT本身，一旦用户完成购买，所有权在区块链网络上完成转让，平台方就没有权力再对该NFT进行任何操作。

对于NFT上所承载的艺术品则有所不同，该作品的所有权和相应的知识产权是否会随NFT转移，需要根据项目的具体条款判断。

**（1）BAYC：买了就能用**

根据BAYC的条款内容，\*\*持有者将获得世界范围内的无限制的许可。\*\*这也就是为什么李宁、绿地、倍轻松等公司能够围绕购买的NFT来进行商业运作。

![李宁 x BAYC#4102](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LOubA_VW_QwlODLqc6msB.png?height=455&width=666)

![绿地 x BAYC#8302](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PPfobYV50vMkdCzfmlAFC.png?height=856&width=640)

![倍轻松 x BAYC#1365](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sRlg5S9LmYXwMWZSc5PTD.png?height=1386&width=640)

不过项目方也没有说完全放弃NFT的商业权利，因此项目方完全可能将该NFT的图片用于其他商业用途，这可能与持有者的使用产生一定冲突。

**（2）AZUKI：要用得经过我同意**

AZUKI于条款前言部分明确说明，**NFT持有者拥有NFT的所有权，但除条款明确授权的范围之外，NFT持有者并未获得艺术作品、品牌及相应的知识产权。**

\*\*想要商用得先经过AZUKI的授权许可，\*\*并且该许可是“非排他性”的，举个例子，用户将他的AZUKI授权给A做广告，项目也可以同时将该NFT授权给B做广告，这可能导致持有者和项目方之间产生一定冲突。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mAA_YB7kG-i_uGDjojbjs.png?height=804&width=640)

**由此可见，对于NFT本身所有权和控制权，持有者购买后即完成转让，项目方再也无权控制；而对于NFT ART（NFT上的图片、视频、音乐等）的商用权利，则需要根据具体条款判断。**

目前大多数项目并没有明确转让NFT ART的商用权利，持有者并不能排除其他方对其持有的NFT艺术作品的商业使用，也就是在商用权利这部分，持有者、项目方或艺术作品的原作者之间可能会发生一定冲突。

## 2

**我可以把我的NFT授权给别人做品牌宣传吗？**

NFT只是一个权属证明，能够用于品牌宣传的，实际上是NFT的底层作品（如图片、视频、音频等）。

**目前对于NFT及底层作品的商业使用，大多是发行方通过许可授权的方式进行，不同平台可能会有差异，所以需要根据发行方具体的声明或协议确定。**

比如BAYC有关商用权利的条款中，就授予了持有者一个可在世界范围内无限制使用的商用许可，并明确持有者可从中获得收益，因此根据该条款，**NFT持有者可以使用BAYC为品牌做宣传并获取收益。**

而在村上隆的太阳花MURAKAMI.FLOWERS相关条款中，就明确声明不会授予持有者商用权利，此种情况下，\*\*NFT持有者如果用该NFT进行商用行为就面临着侵权风险。\*\*村上隆与被Nike收购的RTFKT工作室联合推出的CloneX也有类似条款，明确声明不会授予持有者商用权利。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5CCR46z11i0hksgRWBrty.png?height=656&width=1404)

因此，能否使用NFT底层作品为品牌做推广，或用于其他商业用途，并从中获取收益，还需根据NFT的商用权利相关协议内容具体判断。

## 3

**我如果想找个NFT做形象代言，应该和谁谈？**

**形象代言属于商业权利的范畴，想要找代言，首先要明确该NFT商业权利的归属方。**

**如果项目方将商业权利授予了持有者，则可以直接联系持有者进行合作。**

如AZUKI相关条款中，在授予NFT持有者商用权利的同时，亦授予了再许可的权利，也就是持有者可以直接授权你进行使用。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d5BrAegXPq3mzKIlycAFU.png?height=82&width=692)

**如果项目方保留了商业权利，那么品牌主还需要进一步了解授权方式，**比如需要通过几方的授权、是否为独家授权等，在这过程中可能需要同时协调持有者、发行方以及创作者等，处理不当可能会产生侵权风险。

如太阳花MURAKAMI.FLOWERS相关条款声明，并未授予NFT持有者商用权利，且底层作品的相关商用权利究竟归属于谁也并未明示，想要获得类似该项目NFT底层作品的商用权利显然不易。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TsixP6NMqShzXObtQZehY.png?height=58&width=692)

NFT本质上其对应作品的权利凭证，持有该凭证者（NFT持有者）享有的权利范围，仍取决于发行方。品牌主在与NFT持有者合作时，**注意不要踏入“持有=所有权利”的误区。**

在国内的NFT数字藏品领域，已经有司法案例显示，部分发行方存在权利瑕疵，即未经原艺术家充分授权，就将艺术作品发行为NFT，这会导致购买了NFT的持有者的权利也存在瑕疵，比如国内NFT侵权第一案中，某平台在未取得原作者马千里授权的情况下就将其作品“胖虎打疫苗”制作成NFT在平台上进行销售，法院最终也是判定平台构成侵权。

在海外发行的NFT中，交易所一般也不会对NFT背后的授权进行详细审查，这无疑也会放大品牌主与NFT持有者进行授权合作时的侵权风险。比如灰昼的作品在发到国内数藏平台后被他人在Opensea上架并包装成一个NFT头像项目。

因此，**对于NFT进行审慎的权利尽职调查，应当是NFT商业合作的第一步行动。**

## 4

**NFT商业权利的使用范围能更改吗？**

NFT项目的商业权利，主要来自于项目发行方的权利声明。

**目前主流的权利声明形式，均是由NFT项目发行方通过自行公告的形式予以公示，缺乏具有公信力的备案机构**，这意味着项目可能会自行篡改。

还有一种情况就是发行方直接在条款中明确保留其修改相关声明和协议的权利，比如AZUKI。

一般来说，发行方的商业权利说明应该认为是NFT交易合同的一部分，既然是合同，那么在未经双方同意的情况下，单方是无权作出变更的。因此，即使项目方修改了商业权利声明，也只能对修改后的交易产生影响，而不能回溯影响此前已经发售的NFT。

**对于NFT的购买者而言，审查并留存交易当时发布的商业权利声明，对于维护自身权益有重要意义。**我们也呼吁从商业诚信的角度，NFT项目方应当发挥WEB3精神，将商业权利声明写入到智能合约中，利用区块链不可篡改的特性来保障各方的权益。

## 5

**NFT当初在设立时的商业权利的条款是否会影响其被收购和投资？**

该问题可从两方面考虑。\*\*一是NFT是否可再次转让，\*\*目前常见NFT项目大多都是允许再转让的，所以这种一般不会有阻碍。\*\*二是商业权利的授权范围，\*\*投资者可能会考察商业权利授权范围是否符合其具体需求，如授权许可范围过于狭小，则可能影响投资者的投资意愿。

**操作指南**

所以如果你想要购买NFT或者找NFT进行商业合作，可以先到项目方的官网找到商业权利的相关条款，然后进行以下操作：

* CTRL+F 搜索 “ownership”，重点看跟“the art”“artwork”相关的条款；
* 如果出现了“grant”的字眼，可能意味着要取得发行方授权；
* 如果出现“non-exclusive”、“license”等字眼，则先缓一缓，再确认授权的具体内容；
* 如果出现“no other rights”、“do not receive”等，则说明项目方保留了商业权利，你不能进行商用。

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously just do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which you obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon experiencing reality for the first time, you are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, develop an awareness of your existence (‘consciousness’), achieve control of your thoughts (‘agency’ or ‘creativity’), and eventually learn from your environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’) and the connections are a model that describes the functional i/o relationships between bits (‘understanding’). It is as if reality is a Turing-Complete system and our brains are the Turing Machine (lol… not an original analogy). Putting this all together, we exist in reality as a conscious, intelligent agent perceiving a series of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. The one thing missing in this analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is actually inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it in a future post.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their observations and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events which we did not personally experience (and even when we do observe things … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, feelings, emotions, and motivation) which we may not be aware of in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). You must first become aware of bias in order to account for its influence and gain perspective. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![Well-intentioned Hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8an7nIIUras2V8RIOlnY.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise, not truth-seeking\*\*\*. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and imaginative renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. It simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![Proof requires infinite precision (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt"). Conjecture is imminent in court rulings.](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. An accurate assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate account of history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that the world was deterministic because everything can be explained. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series which breaks down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to navigate through reality. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are *First Principles* -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> “**What I cannot create, I do not understand**”
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root.

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Explanations have degrees of completeness. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and leaves nothing to chance. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as true. One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation describes a fundamental truth (a law of nature) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). The goal of knowledge is to find more knowledge.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). Knowledge is not scarce. It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It just exists. It is the purest form of objectivity. Frankly, it does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one major exception. The only natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability about the probability distribution of electrons in spacetime. This gets more interesting when you consider spacetime as a series of sequential instances of reality with quantum randomness at the root. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing information gaps. Here are two ways to reduce information gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- using observations to find correlations between hypothesized independent data and the resulting dependent data.

2\.) explanatory methods -- using imagination to create logical arguments for cause and effect relationships.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem. Empirical methods are useful to identify information gaps. Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you are getting closer to a casual relationship (though there still may be confounding variables or unaccounted factors which are the root cause). However, correlation is not causation …. so … how do you know if your independent factors are truly independent? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Only explanations can generate new knowledge from information not apparent in the observations. An explanation can implicate unknown factor as the root cause.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire knowledge. Lean on *First Principles* thinking. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power\*\*\*\*\*\*. At the same time, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information … so get used to it!

If we assume that reality is deterministic, then do we have free will? Can there be a meaning to life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? Can meaning be defined? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding, but rather consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is also true.

\*\*\*\*\*We may get to this at some point.

\*\*\*\*\*\*Explanatory power is the degree to which a factor causes an effect.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

title: 买了NFT就能随便用来代言吗？
body:
熊市里，NFT投机者Alice自动变成了NFT收藏者和Builder。除了持续在所持有的NFT社区中进行推广之外，Alice也想为手中的“小图片”寻求新的商业价值。Bob有一家自创的消费品品牌，目前想在Web3和元宇宙里寻找新生代代言人。Alice是否能将手里的NFT授权Bob成为联名款商品？这背后会不会有版权问题呢？

实际上，将NFT用于品牌推广已经有成功的案例，比如我们熟知的运动潮牌中国李宁和NFT蓝筹项目BAYC，李宁在买入BAYC#4102之后，就以该NFT的形象为蓝本发售了“中国李宁无聊猿潮流运动俱乐部”系列产品，还打造了一个BAYC#4102的巨型像素化雕塑举办了一场“无聊不无聊”为主题的快闪活动，吸引了一大波关注科技潮流的年轻人，也带着NFT狠狠地出了一次圈。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/g8P1R_qyMS2JzAt9DL1Z4.png?height=640&width=640)

但并非所有NFT项目都是这样，本文将以市场上几个蓝筹项目为例，分析NFT中各种权利的区别、NFT商用过程中可能遇到的风险、持有者该如何运用NFT赋予的权益等。

**观点提炼**

* 买了一个NFT≠可以随意商用，因为NFT跟NFT上的图片不是一回事；
* 买了Azuki可能碰到合法的“撞Logo”，因为Azuki的图片商业授权不排他；
* 有的NFT买来就能商用，有的需要先授权，也有的禁止商用，这取决于发行方的授权方式；
* 品牌主寻找NFT的合作需要先搞清楚该NFT商业权利的归属；
* 目前NFT的商业条款缺乏有公信力的背书，存在发行方篡改的风险

## 1

**为什么我买了BAYC之后，Yuga Labs 还能继续用我的NFT进行宣传推广？**

在回答这个问题之前，需要先区别两个概念，**NFT与NFT上所承载的艺术作品（NFT ART），是两个不同的概念，代表着不同的权利。**

以图片NFT为例，**NFT仅仅是图片在区块链网络中的权属证明，不一定包含图片（NFT ART）及其附着的知识产权，也就是拥有NFT并不一定同时拥有对应的知识产权。**

对于NFT本身，一旦用户完成购买，所有权在区块链网络上完成转让，平台方就没有权力再对该NFT进行任何操作。

对于NFT上所承载的艺术品则有所不同，该作品的所有权和相应的知识产权是否会随NFT转移，需要根据项目的具体条款判断。

**（1）BAYC：买了就能用**

根据BAYC的条款内容，**持有者将获得世界范围内的无限制的许可。**这也就是为什么李宁、绿地、倍轻松等公司能够围绕购买的NFT来进行商业运作。

![李宁 x BAYC#4102](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LOubA_VW_QwlODLqc6msB.png?height=455&width=666)

![绿地 x BAYC#8302](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PPfobYV50vMkdCzfmlAFC.png?height=856&width=640)

![倍轻松 x BAYC#1365](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/sRlg5S9LmYXwMWZSc5PTD.png?height=1386&width=640)

不过项目方也没有说完全放弃NFT的商业权利，因此项目方完全可能将该NFT的图片用于其他商业用途，这可能与持有者的使用产生一定冲突。

**（2）AZUKI：要用得经过我同意**

AZUKI于条款前言部分明确说明，**NFT持有者拥有NFT的所有权，但除条款明确授权的范围之外，NFT持有者并未获得艺术作品、品牌及相应的知识产权。**

**想要商用得先经过AZUKI的授权许可**，并且该许可是“非排他性”的，举个例子，用户将他的AZUKI授权给A做广告，项目也可以同时将该NFT授权给B做广告，这可能导致持有者和项目方之间产生一定冲突。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mAA_YB7kG-i_uGDjojbjs.png?height=804&width=640)

**由此可见，对于NFT本身所有权和控制权，持有者购买后即完成转让，项目方再也无权控制；而对于NFT ART（NFT上的图片、视频、音乐等）的商用权利，则需要根据具体条款判断。**

目前大多数项目并没有明确转让NFT ART的商用权利，持有者并不能排除其他方对其持有的NFT艺术作品的商业使用，也就是在商用权利这部分，持有者、项目方或艺术作品的原作者之间可能会发生一定冲突。

## 2

**我可以把我的NFT授权给别人做品牌宣传吗？**

NFT只是一个权属证明，能够用于品牌宣传的，实际上是NFT的底层作品（如图片、视频、音频等）。

**目前对于NFT及底层作品的商业使用，大多是发行方通过许可授权的方式进行，不同平台可能会有差异，所以需要根据发行方具体的声明或协议确定。**

比如BAYC有关商用权利的条款中，就授予了持有者一个可在世界范围内无限制使用的商用许可，并明确持有者可从中获得收益，因此根据该条款，**NFT持有者可以使用BAYC为品牌做宣传并获取收益。**

而在村上隆的太阳花MURAKAMI.FLOWERS相关条款中，就明确声明不会授予持有者商用权利，此种情况下，**NFT持有者如果用该NFT进行商用行为就面临着侵权风险。**村上隆与被Nike收购的RTFKT工作室联合推出的CloneX也有类似条款，明确声明不会授予持有者商用权利。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5CCR46z11i0hksgRWBrty.png?height=656&width=1404)

因此，能否使用NFT底层作品为品牌做推广，或用于其他商业用途，并从中获取收益，还需根据NFT的商用权利相关协议内容具体判断。

## 3

**我如果想找个NFT做形象代言，应该和谁谈？**

**形象代言属于商业权利的范畴，想要找代言，首先要明确该NFT商业权利的归属方。**

**如果项目方将商业权利授予了持有者，则可以直接联系持有者进行合作。**

如AZUKI相关条款中，在授予NFT持有者商用权利的同时，亦授予了再许可的权利，也就是持有者可以直接授权你进行使用。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/d5BrAegXPq3mzKIlycAFU.png?height=82&width=692)

**如果项目方保留了商业权利，那么品牌主还需要进一步了解授权方式，**比如需要通过几方的授权、是否为独家授权等，在这过程中可能需要同时协调持有者、发行方以及创作者等，处理不当可能会产生侵权风险。

如太阳花MURAKAMI.FLOWERS相关条款声明，并未授予NFT持有者商用权利，且底层作品的相关商用权利究竟归属于谁也并未明示，想要获得类似该项目NFT底层作品的商用权利显然不易。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/TsixP6NMqShzXObtQZehY.png?height=58&width=692)

NFT本质上其对应作品的权利凭证，持有该凭证者（NFT持有者）享有的权利范围，仍取决于发行方。品牌主在与NFT持有者合作时，**注意不要踏入“持有=所有权利”的误区。**

在国内的NFT数字藏品领域，已经有司法案例显示，部分发行方存在权利瑕疵，即未经原艺术家充分授权，就将艺术作品发行为NFT，这会导致购买了NFT的持有者的权利也存在瑕疵，比如国内NFT侵权第一案中，某平台在未取得原作者马千里授权的情况下就将其作品“胖虎打疫苗”制作成NFT在平台上进行销售，法院最终也是判定平台构成侵权。

在海外发行的NFT中，交易所一般也不会对NFT背后的授权进行详细审查，这无疑也会放大品牌主与NFT持有者进行授权合作时的侵权风险。比如灰昼的作品在发到国内数藏平台后被他人在Opensea上架并包装成一个NFT头像项目。

因此，**对于NFT进行审慎的权利尽职调查，应当是NFT商业合作的第一步行动。**

## 4

**NFT商业权利的使用范围能更改吗？**

NFT项目的商业权利，主要来自于项目发行方的权利声明。

**目前主流的权利声明形式，均是由NFT项目发行方通过自行公告的形式予以公示，缺乏具有公信力的备案机构**，这意味着项目可能会自行篡改。

还有一种情况就是发行方直接在条款中明确保留其修改相关声明和协议的权利，比如AZUKI。

一般来说，发行方的商业权利说明应该认为是NFT交易合同的一部分，既然是合同，那么在未经双方同意的情况下，单方是无权作出变更的。因此，即使项目方修改了商业权利声明，也只能对修改后的交易产生影响，而不能回溯影响此前已经发售的NFT。

**对于NFT的购买者而言，审查并留存交易当时发布的商业权利声明，对于维护自身权益有重要意义。**我们也呼吁从商业诚信的角度，NFT项目方应当发挥WEB3精神，将商业权利声明写入到智能合约中，利用区块链不可篡改的特性来保障各方的权益。

## 5

**NFT当初在设立时的商业权利的条款是否会影响其被收购和投资？**

该问题可从两方面考虑。**一是NFT是否可再次转让，**目前常见NFT项目大多都是允许再转让的，所以这种一般不会有阻碍。**二是商业权利的授权范围，**投资者可能会考察商业权利授权范围是否符合其具体需求，如授权许可范围过于狭小，则可能影响投资者的投资意愿。

**操作指南**

所以如果你想要购买NFT或者找NFT进行商业合作，可以先到项目方的官网找到商业权利的相关条款，然后进行以下操作：

* CTRL+F 搜索 “ownership”，重点看跟“the art”“artwork”相关的条款；
* 如果出现了“grant”的字眼，可能意味着要取得发行方授权；
* 如果出现“non-exclusive”、“license”等字眼，则先缓一缓，再确认授权的具体内容；
* 如果出现“no other rights”、“do not receive”等，则说明项目方保留了商业权利，你不能进行商用。

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously just do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which you obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon experiencing reality for the first time, you are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, develop an awareness of your existence (‘consciousness’), achieve control of your thoughts (‘agency’ or ‘creativity’), and eventually learn from your environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’) and the connections are a model that describes the functional i/o relationships between bits (‘understanding’). It is as if reality is a Turing-Complete system and our brains are the Turing Machine (lol… not an original analogy). Putting this all together, we exist in reality as a conscious, intelligent agent perceiving a series of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. The one thing missing in this analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is actually inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it in a future post.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their observations and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events which we did not personally experience (and even when we do observe things … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, feelings, emotions, and motivation) which we may not be aware of in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). You must first become aware of bias in order to account for its influence and gain perspective. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![Well-intentioned Hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_8an7nIIUras2V8RIOlnY.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise, not truth-seeking\*\*\*. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and imaginative renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. It simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![Proof requires infinite precision (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt"). Conjecture is imminent in court rulings.](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. An accurate assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate account of history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that the world was deterministic because everything can be explained. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series which breaks down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to navigate through reality. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are *First Principles* -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> “**What I cannot create, I do not understand**”
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root.

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Explanations have degrees of completeness. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and leaves nothing to chance. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as true. One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation describes a fundamental truth (a law of nature) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). The goal of knowledge is to find more knowledge.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). Knowledge is not scarce. It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It just exists. It is the purest form of objectivity. Frankly, it does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this realization is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change in our lives. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one major exception. The only natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability about the probability distribution of electrons in spacetime. This gets more interesting when you consider spacetime as a series of sequential instances of reality with quantum randomness at the root. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing information gaps. Here are two ways to reduce information gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- using observations to find correlations between hypothesized independent data and the resulting dependent data.

2\.) explanatory methods -- using imagination to create logical arguments for cause and effect relationships.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem. Empirical methods are useful to identify information gaps. Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you are getting closer to a casual relationship (though there still may be confounding variables or unaccounted factors which are the root cause). However, correlation is not causation …. so … how do you know if your independent factors are truly independent? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Only explanations can generate new knowledge from information not apparent in the observations. An explanation can implicate unknown factor as the root cause.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire knowledge. Lean on *First Principles* thinking. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power\*\*\*\*\*\*. At the same time, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information … so get used to it!

If we assume that reality is deterministic, then do we have free will? Can there be a meaning to life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? Can meaning be defined? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding, but rather consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is also true.

\*\*\*\*\*We may get to this at some point.

\*\*\*\*\*\*Explanatory power is the degree to which a factor causes an effect.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

**OllO**是一个手工交易的先进控制组合的 DeFi 协议，准备在**Cosmos**上发布。llO 计划通过自动化投资计划，为用户提供资产和头的完整介绍。可提供的 AMM 池、订单簿交易者为交易者，我们的重点是具有经济学的先进性、便利的投资工具和简单的交易。平台和代币专为**长期增长和卓越而设计**。奥尔代经济学具有随着存储的广泛应用未来的商业运作结构，可以在整个链条的持续运行和持续的时间里进行调整。费用，以便从传统排放过渡到链产生的排放。

OllO Fi

**OllO**的创新 DeFi控制交易平台**OllO。Cosmos**构建、构建、构建、构建、组合和投资管理例如整个 cosmo 的自动化 SDK。流动性池开发、优化、流动质素资产管理，并持续阅读、推动质押Fi。在不断变化的环境中，OllO Fi 推动创新器的发展。以了解我们的团队如何创新。

## Interchain Dex AMM & 订单簿

OllO 利用区块链间通信 (IBC) 来实现跨链交易。IBC 提供了当今存在的最惊人的跨链基础设施。许多最好的链已经连接到 IBC，使我们能够创建一个连接惊人的 DeFi 平台。提供订单簿交易允许用户完全控制他们买卖的价格，并让他们了解市场状况。除了 IBC 资产之外，OllO Interchain Dex 将提供创建具有跨链资产的独特池。向 Osmosis 的定制 AMM 设计致敬，OllO 将提供我们自己独特的定制 AMM，以允许用户创建具有独特参数的定制池，例如结合曲线、可定制的资产权重和更多 TBA。添加 LP 自动化控制并完全控制您的产品组合。

## 自动化的投资组合管理

OllO 正在提供自动化的投资组合管理工具，以简化用户资产、职位和奖励的管理。用户将可以使用**自动交易**工具来管理他们的投资组合。对流动性头寸设置限制参数，购买、出售、交换、拆分、股权、复合和混合资产和奖励以实现完全控制。现在，我们为您提供一种自动交换和复合您的奖励资产的方法。想要在马厩中获得报酬吗？想要获得一定比例的马厩和一定比例的汽车复合？DeFi 的未来令人兴奋，保护您的投资也是如此。OllO Fi 将为用户提供永久性损失保护，这是一种自动化的 LP 功能，可降低风险承受能力并保护用户投资。

## 收益优化器

在 OllO，我们相信社区和简化交易，因此我们提供收益优化器来自动复合您的股份和 LP 收益。除了复合您的原生股份外，现在您还可以选择自动复合您的任何 LP，包括原生池和聚合社区池。

## 流动质押

幸运的是，我们在最先进的网络上，Cosmos 已经启用了流动质押。OllO 正在开发自己独特的流动质押版本，称为量子质押。详细信息即将推出。

OllO 通过 2 部分的空投回馈 Cosmos 质押社区。**第 1 部分 \*已拍摄快照\***分配旨在奖励**Atom 质押者 + 奖金链和奖金分配待定。**\~**第 2 部分**将分发给**第一年的 OllO 质押者。**全年都会拍摄快照。为了保持资格，用户必须全年保留最低质押数量的 OllO。未质押的代表团过早放弃其分配，然后分配给剩余的第一年质押者。明智，保持赌注，获得报酬

# 社区提议

OllO Fi 的灵感来自通过 Cosmos 项目聚集在一起的令人惊叹的社区。OllO 团队希望通过提供一个直观简单且易于使用的平台来为 Cosmos 带来新用户。通过有用的提示和详细的使用说明，为新的和有经验的加密用户提供更舒适的交易体验。我们相信交易更聪明而不是更难。

title: 介绍 OllO Fi 的愿景
body:
\- 交易更聪明而不是更难。

***注意：OllO 的关注点将展示我们 OllO 的代和平台愿景和目标。这不是功能承诺。***

# OllO 和可持续的 DeFi 简介

**OllO**是一个手工交易的先进控制组合的 DeFi 协议，准备在**Cosmos**上发布。llO 计划通过自动化投资计划，为用户提供资产和头的完整介绍。可提供的 AMM 池、订单簿交易者为交易者，我们的重点是具有经济学的先进性、便利的投资工具和简单的交易。平台和代币专为**长期增长和卓越而设计**。奥尔代经济学具有随着存储的广泛应用未来的商业运作结构，可以在整个链条的持续运行和持续的时间里进行调整。费用，以便从传统排放过渡到链产生的排放。

# OllO Fi

OllO 的创新 DeFi 平台 OllO Fi 旨在简化交易和资产管理。 OllO Fi 使用 Cosmos SDK 构建，通过自动化和投资组合管理简化了整个 cosmos 的交易。 OllO 计划提供对许多功能的自动控制，例如交易、限价单、质押、流动性池、收益优化器、流动质押、资产管理，而这仅仅是开始。在不断变化的 DeFi 环境中，创新是长寿的关键，OllO Fi 致力于开发未来的 DeFi 工具。继续阅读以了解我们的团队如何创新。

## Interchain Dex AMM & 订单簿

OllO 利用区块链间通信 (IBC) 来实现跨链交易。IBC 提供了当今存在的最惊人的跨链基础设施。许多最好的链已经连接到 IBC，使我们能够创建一个连接惊人的 DeFi 平台。提供订单簿交易允许用户完全控制他们买卖的价格，并让他们了解市场状况。除了 IBC 资产之外，OllO Interchain Dex 将提供创建具有跨链资产的独特池。向 Osmosis 的定制 AMM 设计致敬，OllO 将提供我们自己独特的定制 AMM，以允许用户创建具有独特参数的定制池，例如结合曲线、可定制的资产权重和更多 TBA。添加 LP 自动化控制并完全控制您的产品组合。

## 自动化的投资组合管理

OllO 正在提供自动化的投资组合管理工具，以简化用户资产、职位和奖励的管理。用户将可以使用**自动交易**工具来管理他们的投资组合。对流动性头寸设置限制参数，购买、出售、交换、拆分、股权、复合和混合资产和奖励以实现完全控制。现在，我们为您提供一种自动交换和复合您的奖励资产的方法。想要在马厩中获得报酬吗？想要获得一定比例的马厩和一定比例的汽车复合？DeFi 的未来令人兴奋，保护您的投资也是如此。OllO Fi 将为用户提供永久性损失保护，这是一种自动化的 LP 功能，可降低风险承受能力并保护用户投资。

## 收益优化器

在 OllO，我们相信社区和简化交易，因此我们提供收益优化器来自动复合您的股份和 LP 收益。除了复合您的原生股份外，现在您还可以选择自动复合您的任何 LP，包括原生池和聚合社区池。

## 流动质押

幸运的是，我们在最先进的网络上，Cosmos 已经启用了流动质押。OllO 正在开发自己独特的流动质押版本，称为量子质押。详细信息即将推出。

# The Wisedrop

title: Hekonai #2
body:
I burst into the swordmaker's shop! Well, stumbled is more honest: my heroic reflexes are a work in progress.

I was ready to challenge the swordmaker... but no one was there. On the table was the most magnificent sword I've ever seen, with a note next to it. It read "Fall seven times, stand up eight."  I thought to myself: *is this fate showing its hand?*  I took the sword from its sheath and its blade burst into flame!

![Illustration by Mirsub Fazlani (innovativepixels_art)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HElKwGMqVlre7ejYJFK8Z.jpg?height=458&width=1413)

At that moment, a magic feeling rippled through my entire being. I looked down and saw my body reshape and transform itself. I looked over at a mirror: my face became the artfully drawn one I saw on the moon's surface. I felt like a butterfly emerging from its chrysalis. It was glorious.

I let out my best heroic yell and swung the sword. It opened a slash in space and time! Through it, I saw a dark void. It looked like an impossibly long hallway with swirling lights at the end.  I froze in my tracks. Everything was happening so fast.

![Illustration by Mirsub Fazlani (innovativepixels_art)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8U0FL5NcKevsP1tC3j5Fy.png?height=565&width=1379&&&&size=medium)

Then I took a deep breath, put on my best 'fierce samurai' expression, and stepped into the void.

![Illustration by Mirsub Fazlani (innovativepixels_art)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ppysTphr4t2IU6OevReqv.png?height=663&width=1192&&&&&size=large)

Please enjoy the next post #3 below in the Hekonai Journal:

[https://mirror.xyz/cryptoanimedao.eth/QLPwaWxefYTau2lqjwCeFhhghe0zWxt4FnLWfhumK4w](https://mirror.xyz/cryptoanimedao.eth/QLPwaWxefYTau2lqjwCeFhhghe0zWxt4FnLWfhumK4w)

**[Post Soundtrack:](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TJVxwPoHRSM)**[ Vessels - Philip Glass](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TJVxwPoHRSM)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TJVxwPoHRSM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TJVxwPoHRSM)

Into the author’s mind: *“This awe-inspiring cue is part of the soundtrack for the documentary Koyaanisqatsi. When I first heard it, I was struck by how Glass could take minimalist melodic motifs and build them into this grandiose cathedral of sound through inventive arranging and layering of the elements. This post captures Hekonai's moment of rebirth so the sense of wonder and the sheer joy of creation in the music made it my immediate and obvious soundtrack choice.”*

**The Hekonai's Journal is an ongoing meta-narrative. If you want to learn how it came to be, check out the introduction post by clicking [here](https://mirror.xyz/cryptoanimedao.eth/Kqx2WGy6yeTxUNEFloZyBJNMzG-HY-qjSn5sF5TQHvo). If you want to read the journal entries from the very beginning, click [here](https://mirror.xyz/cryptoanimedao.eth/5iAMrCM5CEnvK9v5kI_Q-XPrdDeI2ZFb81vITelNcIU).**
